intro: Tristemon albus, commonly known as the white tristemon, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, white flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Tristemon albus is not widely cultivated but is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
